pageContext.claim: “We cannot continue to allow ourselves to be duped on military and also duped on trade, with the European Union, as an example. Last year, on trade [with the EU], we lost $151 billion.”
pageContext.analysis: The European Union countries combined are the top export market for the United States. The actual trade deficit with the EU is about $100 billion because the U.S. has a services surplus of about $50 billion. Trump's focus on the trade deficit is misplaced, as the United States and the EU have total trade in goods of more than $700 billion, with U.S. exports to the EU in 2015 supporting more than 2.6 million U.S. jobs, according to the Census Bureau.
